title: Ahead of the Midterms, Energy Lobbyists Plan for a Republican House
description: The oil and gas industry is already setting priorities for at least partial G.O.P. control in Congress, with a particular focus on undercutting a Biden administration program to shift away from gas for home heating.
dc:creator: Eric Lipton
category: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
media:credit: T.J. Kirkpatrick for The New York Times
media:description: The Capitol Power Plant in Washington, D.C. Energy lobbyists are preparing for the possibility of Republicans taking control of the House, and are taking aim in particular at a Biden administration program encouraging a shift from natural gas to electricity for home heating.
